title: [Large-Scale] Resident Learning Competency Enhancement Program Through Emergency Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic first-aid knowledge and mathematical problem-solving skills
context.additional_context: Simulation learning environment that recreates actual emergency situations through mathematical modeling

learning_goals: Analyze the decision-making process in emergency situations through mathematical modeling and develop optimal resource allocation strategies
Prioritize and mathematically design treatment protocols for multiple patient emergency cases within a limited timeframe

Within one week, learners will complete ≥3 team-based problem-solving sessions in a simulation environment. They will record activity logs and performance analysis data from each session in a portfolio template and compile a personal learning portfolio achieving ≥70 points on an evaluation rubric: participation (20%), problem-solving effectiveness (40%), and collaboration skills (40%).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
